hints.title: Vanishing Source at QSD
hints.content:
224: :label: prop-qsd-vanishing-source
225: 
226: Near the quasi-stationary distribution (QSD), the source term $J^\nu$ vanishes to leading order:
227: 
228: $$
229: J^\nu|_{\text{QSD}} = O(\epsilon)
230: $$
231: 
232: where $\epsilon$ measures deviation from equilibrium.
233:

221: ### 4.7. Recovery of Standard GR at QSD Equilibrium
222: 
223: :::{prf:proposition} Vanishing Source at QSD
224: :label: prop-qsd-vanishing-source
225: 
226: Near the quasi-stationary distribution (QSD), the source term $J^\nu$ vanishes to leading order:
227: 
228: $$
229: J^\nu|_{\text{QSD}} = O(\epsilon)
230: $$
231: 
232: where $\epsilon$ measures deviation from equilibrium.
233: 
234: **Consequence**: In the QSD limit, the modified equations $\nabla_\mu G^{\mu\nu} = \kappa J^\nu$ reduce to standard Einstein equations:
235: 
236: $$
237: G_{\mu\nu} = 8\pi G \, T_{\mu\nu}

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-21
hints.content:
240: 
241: :::{prf:proof}
242: **Step 1**: At QSD, the measure $\mu_t$ satisfies:
243: 
244: $$
245: \partial_t \mu_{\text{QSD}} = 0
246: $$
247: 
248: **Step 2**: The McKean-Vlasov equation at stationarity implies:
249: 
250: $$
251: v \cdot \nabla_x \mu_{\text{QSD}} + \nabla_v \cdot (F[\mu_{\text{QSD}}] \mu_{\text{QSD}}) = \frac{\gamma + \sigma^2}{2} \Delta_v \mu_{\text{QSD}}
252: $$
253: 
254: **Step 3**: Taking moments of this equation:
255: 
256: Energy balance:
257: $$
258: \gamma \langle v^2 \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = \sigma^2 d/2 + O(\epsilon)
259: $$
260: 
261: (equipartition theorem)
262: 
263: Momentum balance:
264: $$
265: -\gamma \langle v^j \rangle_{\text{QSD}} + \langle F_{\text{adapt}}^j \rangle_{\text{QSD}} = O(\epsilon)
266: $$
267: 
268: **Step 4**: These balances imply $J^0|_{\text{QSD}} = O(\epsilon)$ and $J^j|_{\text{QSD}} = O(\epsilon)$.
269: 
270: **Step 5**: Therefore, at QSD:
271: 
272: $$
273: \nabla_\mu T^{\mu\nu}|_{\text{QSD}} = 0 + O(\epsilon)
274: $$
